thread.title: Classic Baked Corn Pudding Recipe
thread.title_full: Classic Baked Corn Pudding Recipe

posts.author: Diana Rattray
posts.title: Classic Baked Corn Pudding Recipe
posts.text:
This custard-like corn pudding is very tasty, and it's the perfect accompaniment for a roast or baked ham . It's also an excellent side dish for a holiday dinner.
The pudding starts with a simple white sauce. The sauce is mixed with cream-style and whole kernel corn and then beaten eggs are added to make the mixture light and fluffy.
We sweeten corn pudding with some extra sugar but feel free to reduce the sugar or omit it.
What You'll Need 4 tablespoons butter 1/2 cup all-purpose flour 2 tablespoons sugar 1 teaspoon salt 1 cup milk 1 can (approx. 15 ounces) cream-style corn 1 can (approx. 15 ounces) whole kernel corn, or about 2 cups frozen thawed 3 eggs, separated How to Make It Heat oven to 350 F. Melt butter in a saucepan over medium-low heat; add flour, stirring until mixture is well blended. Cook, stirring, for 1 to 2 minutes. Gradually stir in the milk; add sugar and salt. Cook, whisking constantly, until smooth and thickened. ​The mixture will be thick. Remove from heat and stir in cream-style and kernel corn. Lightly beat egg yolks, and then add to the corn mixture. In a grease-free bowl, beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Fold egg whites into the mixture. Transfer to a 2-quart buttered casserole . Set the casserole in a larger pan and put in the oven. Add hot water to the large pan to a depth of about 1 inch. Bake for about 45 minutes. Tips and Variations
Replace the whole kernel corn with fiesta-style corn with peppers. Add 3 to 4 tablespoons of finely chopped red and green bell peppers.
You Might Also Like

thread.title: Buying Tips Before You Buy Anti-Fatigue Mats
thread.title_full: Buying Tips Before You Buy Anti-Fatigue Mats

posts.author: Mariette Mifflin
posts.title: Buying Tips Before You Buy Anti-Fatigue Mats
posts.text:
SmartCells 24-Inch by 36-Inch anti-fatigue mat, Amazon
There are many anti-fatigue mats on the market, some of which are designed for use in an industrial setting where workers stand for hours at the same workstation, while others have a lighter nature intended for light duty work in the home environment.
But many spend countless hours in the home kitchen, garage or workshop, baking, cooking or tinkering. And this can put the same undue stress on your feet and body, as it does for the industrial worker.
If you have very hard surface floors like ceramic tile, even one standing hour can be grueling.
The solution is a properly suited and well-designed anti-fatigue mat that can reduce foot stress and related back and knee problems. But with so many choices on the market, it can be difficult to find the right one for your particular needs. Hopefully, these tips will better equip you when it comes to buying an anti-fatigue mat.
Do You Need an Anti-Fatigue Mat? Let's face it, it's always nice to step onto a soft and comfy mat when you rise from the bed or you're standing at the bathroom sink. But while softness and light cushioning may seem comfortable, it may not be adequate to reduce the risk of stress and foot fatigue, when it comes to standing in the same spot for an hour or more. This type of cushioning is limited in terms of shock-absorbing and stress-relieving qualities. When you need more than soft cushioning, it's time for an anti-fatigue mat.
Anyone who suffers from foot, knee or back pain should consider some type of anti-fatigue mat, to reduce the stress on the body caused by standing for any length of time at the kitchen counter , bathroom sink or workbench.
The average cook or home chef can benefit greatly from an anti-fatigue mat to prevent foot stress problems.
And for those who spend hours standing such as the car or hobby buffs, busy cooks, home-based caterers or professional cooks, an anti-fatigue mat is essential.
Regular Floor Mats vs Anti-Fatigue Mats When a little cushioning is all that's needed, carpeted mats are probably the most economical and may be sufficient for light duty if they have a rubber backing for safety. But make sure that they are washable and will withstand many washings. There's also a good array of rubber or foam vinyl-covered mats for home use, but these may lack anti-fatigue properties and simply provide light cushioning. Rubber interlocking mats sold in hardware stores for workshops or play areas can also be very practical and economical for light duty, depending on use.
What about gel mats? They're certainly worth considering for light duty. Many people love their gel-filled shoe insoles, so this concept can certainly be extended to the kitchen. It's really a matter of taste and how it feels for you. Gel-filled anti-fatigue mats tend to be much higher priced and this may be a constraint. Because kitchen mats may feel great for one person and not another, keep in mind that it may take trial and error to find the right one for you.
Anti-fatigue mats generally have some stress relieving qualities, but not all are equal in terms of materials, features, and benefits. Some are considered light duty, while others have industrial-grade properties that make them better suited for heavy-duty use. And for those who spend hours in the kitchen or home shop, this is the type of anti-fatigue mat you need.
An industrial-grade anti-fatigue mat should be at least 3/8" thick and constructed with special properties to alleviate foot stress. See below for more information on density. Look for a top pattern that is easy to wipe clean and suitable sizing for your area. Though a heavy duty anti-fatigue mat may not be as pretty as some kitchen mats, remember that it's the quality that counts, and that's a small trade-off when it comes to easing foot pain.
Black is easiest to find; colors are more limited. Be prepared to pay for this grade of the mat; they're usually more expensive.
Buy at Amazon Check prices of interlocking mats at Amazon Check prices of kitchen mats at Amazon Sanitary & Safety Issues Regardless of whether you choose a mat simply based on light cushioning or heavy duty use, if the mat is for your kitchen or bath area, for sanitary reasons it must be washable. Kitchen mats can harbor food bacteria and bathroom mats are prone to germs and should be cleaned regularly.
An anti-fatigue mat with a grid or highly pebbled surface is great for industrial use where it can be hosed down but might be hard to keep clean in the kitchen. When a mat's top layer becomes cracked or peels, cleaning becomes ineffective and the mat should be replaced. Read the product information and for health reasons, make sure you can wash or sanitize it.
To avoid tripping hazards, choose a mat with tapered edges that do not hinder the transition from floor to mat. And balancing on a soft foam mat can also pose a falling hazard to those with stability issues such as seniors.
Thickness, Density & Elements of Anti-Fatigue Mats A dense rubber mat is less tiring than a soft mat and will provide better support. But there's more to consider when it comes to density and a well-designed anti-fatigue mat will be engineered based on key elements that are known to alleviate foot fatigue. Adding a vinyl cover to a foam construction may be fine for a comfy feel, but when you want to reduce foot fatigue, it's just not enough.
A foam mat that is too soft may look and feel nice at first step, but you will be constantly balancing on the mat, similar to walking on sand. That can be extremely fatiguing in the long run. This balancing act also improperly shifts the weight and that can lead to misalignment health issues. For chefs who spend hours cooking or baking, this type is too light to provide a good cushioning.
Mats that are at least 3/8", 1/2" or closer to 1" thick would be best, but not too high to create a tripping hazard.
The best mats will also have a tapered edge to prevent tripping hazards and the wider the taper, the better.
According to SmartCells U.S.A. , their "SmartCells anti-fatigue technology is based on valid, time-tested research, not emotional market-tested buzz words". You'll find some interesting facts and a research paper called the 9 Essential Questions to Ask Before Buying an Anti-Fatigue Mat on their site. This is a very interesting read and it outlines some key elements that should be present in a good anti-fatigue mat. You'll also find expert information on anti-fatigue mat construction that will help with your buying decision.
The bottom line: If you've already experienced foot, knee or back pain and you stand for hours, a lightweight mat will probably be inadequate. Go for an industrial grade mat with essential features to reduce foot strain, such as a SmartCells mat .
Mat Size Considerations
For industrial use, a square mat or long runner may be great, but for counter use, look for a rectangular mat at least 2' x 3' long, or if you have a long counter a 6' - 8' longer mat would be ideal. The worst thing is constantly stepping on and off of a mat when working in the kitchen, so chose the size carefully. You should also avoid positioning a mat where you are likely to be standing one foot on and one foot off, which would lead to posture issues. Measure the counter area where you are likely to spend most of your time and bring these measurements with you when you shop.
For industrial use, a square mat or long runner may be great, but for counter use, look for a rectangular mat at least 2' x 3' long, or if you have a long counter a 6' - 8' longer mat would be ideal. The worst thing is constantly stepping on and off of a mat when working in the kitchen, so choose the size carefully. You should also avoid positioning a mat where you are likely to be standing one foot on and one foot off, which would lead to posture issues. Measure the counter area where you are likely to spend most of your time and bring these measurements with you when you shop.
Where to Find Anti-Fatigue Mats If you prefer to shop online, you'll find a good variety of types and prices of mats available through the Froogle search link provided. For personal shopping, carpeted and foam vinyl-covered mats can be found in most merchandise stores. Interlocking rubber mats are sold in packages or 4 or 6 at hardware or large merchandise stores. Gel-filled mats are available online - try the link provided below. Industrial-grade anti-fatigue mats can be found online or in safety or industrial equipment stores.
Buy at Amazon
This list of manufacturers and retailers is provided as a helpful resource only: Gel Pro Chef's Mats ImprintMats.com Sky Solutions - at Amazon SmartCells U.S.A. Check prices of mats at Amazon

thread.title: Chocolate Covered Ritz Cracker Cookie Treats
thread.title_full: Chocolate Covered Ritz Cracker Cookie Treats Recipe

posts.author: Diana Rattray
posts.title: Chocolate Covered Ritz Cracker Cookie Treats
posts.text:
Use white chocolate candy melts for these Ritz Cracker cookie sandwich treats, or make them with almond bark or melted chocolate. The pictured cookies were made with Halloween in mind, but other colored candy melts and sprinkles can be used for just about any holiday or special occasion.
This recipe will make about 30 Ritz Cracker treats. Feel free to double the ingredients for a crowd.
For decorating ideas and some other helpful tips, see below the recipe.
What You'll Need 60 Ritz Crackers (2 sleeves) 1 pound candy melts (or almond bark, chocolate or white chocolate) 1 cup creamy peanut butter Optional: Sprinkles or colored sugars to match the season How to Make It Line baking sheets with wax paper. Spread a cracker with a thick layer of peanut butter. Gently press another cracker onto the peanut butter layer to make a sandwich cookie. Repeat with the remaining crackers. Melt the almond bark or candy melts in a microwave oven or in the top of a double boiler over simmering water as directed on the package. Dip each sandwich cookie in the melted chocolate or almond bark. With a fork, lift the cookie out and shake gently to let the excess drip off. Place the cookies on the wax paper-lined pan. Before the chocolate sets, sprinkle the treats with colorful decorating sugar or candy sprinkles. Refrigerate until firm. Store in a cool place in an airtight container for up to one week. Tips and Variations
Replace the creamy peanut butter with chunky peanut butter. Fill the Ritz crackers with Nutella or chocolate spread instead of peanut butter. To make homemade dipping chocolate , melt 3 cups of chocolate chips with 3 tablespoons of vegetable shortening in a double boiler over very warm water. Stir to blend. Make sure you do not get even a drop of water or liquid in the chocolate. Dip the assembled Ritz treats in the melted chocolate and set on the wax paper-lined pan. Decorate as desired. You can find candy melts in a variety of colors. To make colored candy melts with white chocolate melts or bark, melt as directed on the package. Add food coloring — preferably gel food coloring — to the melted chocolate until you have the desired shade. You can do this ahead of time — pipe wafer-sized drops of the melted colored candy onto parchment paper. Let it dry and then remove to a container. Re-melt over simmering water or in the microwave oven. Decorating Ideas
Christmas Treats: Use red, green, and white sprinkles. Easter Treats: Use pastels — yellow, lavender, pink, light green, etc. St. Patrick's Day Treats: Use a deep shade of green and bright yellow. July Fourth Treats: Use red, white, and blue. Thanksgiving Treats: Use orange, yellow, and brown.

thread.title: Sweet and Savory Chocolate Bacon Bark
thread.title_full: Sweet and Savory Chocolate Bacon Bark

posts.author: Elizabeth LaBau
posts.title: Sweet and Savory Chocolate Bacon Bark
posts.text:
Bacon and chocolate are a new trend in gourmet chocolate bars, and now you can recreate this unlikely pairing at home! Semi-sweet chocolate is studded with chunks of crispy bacon and cut into small squares to make chocolate bacon bark. It is important that the bacon is fried until it is crispy because the crispy texture greatly improves the taste and texture of the final candy -- soggy strips of bacon are pretty unappealing!
What You'll Need 12 ounces semi-sweet chocolate chips 7 large strips bacon (fried until crispy) How to Make It Prepare a baking sheet by lining it with aluminum foil and set aside for now. Place the chocolate in a microwave-safe bowl and microwave in one-minute increments until melted, stirring after every minute to prevent overheating. While the chocolate is melting, chop the bacon strips into small bits. Set aside approximately one-third of the bacon to be used to top the bark. Once the chocolate is melted and smooth, stir in the remaining two-thirds of the chopped bacon, and stir until the bacon bits are well-incorporated. Pour the chocolate onto the prepared baking sheet , and with an offset spatula or a knife, spread it into a thin layer about 1/4” high. While the chocolate is still wet, sprinkle the top evenly with the reserved chopped bacon and press down gently to adhere it to the surface. Refrigerate the bacon bark to set the chocolate, about 30 minutes. Once set, break it into small uneven pieces by hand, and serve immediately.
Chocolate bacon bark can be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to a week.

thread.title: How to Declutter the Closet in 30 Minutes
thread.title_full: How to Declutter the Closet in 30 Minutes

posts.author: Elizabeth Larkin
posts.title: How to Declutter the Closet in 30 Minutes
posts.text:
01 of 02 How to Declutter the Closet in 30 Minutes Daniela Duncan/Getty Images 30 minutes may not be enough for a total closet makeover, but it’s plenty of time to make a big difference in how a messy (or even not-so-messy) closet looks and functions. Here’s how to improve your closet a lot in a little time.
Before your begin, review your closet organization toolkit to make sure you have everything you need before you begin.
1. Distract yourself. Not too much, but enough to take the boring part out of closet-cleaning. While you’re de-cluttering, listen to music or watch ... MORE something less than completely engrossing on TV. You don’t want to abandon your closet for something more entertaining, you just want to make de-cluttering as enjoyable a process as possible. (If it weren’t for playlists and headphones, my usually very neat apartment might be a mess.)
2. Start at the bottom. The floor of the closet is the least interesting part, as well as the place most likely to be harboring stuff that really belong in some other room or ice skates from 1989 that you forgot you owned. Take everything off the closet floor, give it a quick vacuum or sweep, then place every item back neatly, or move it to another room, a bag of trash or donations, or wherever else it should go.
3. Do a very quick clothing assessment. You don’t have to carefully consider each piece at this point, but scan the clothes hanging in your closet and see if anything jumps out at you and says “I do not belong here.” You’ll probably spot one or two things you’d been meaning to get rid of anyway. Through them in your donation box .
4. Take one additional quick look. After your immediate “no’s” have been removed, touch each hanger for a second and decide if you want to keep what’s on it. You’re not doing any kind of deep thinking here; if you’re uncertain, keep the item for now. But looking at each piece of clothing individually for just a brief moment might turn up several more things you don’t need.
5. Straighten up. Now that you’ve (hopefully) removed some things from your hangers, go through them again and make sure everything is facing the same way and nothing is falling off its hanger.
Continue to 2 of 2 below. 02 of 02 Quickly Decluttering Your Closet Decluttering the closet. Getty 6. Repeat with shelves. If your closet has any shelving in addition to a hanger rod, repeat steps 3, 4, and 5 with the items on the shelves.
7. Take notes. You may have realized some things while de-cluttering. Perhaps you need to buy more hangers, or you suddenly realized you have no black pants but you need them. You don’t have to take any action now – this is just a 30 minute project after all – but jot down any ideas you had while in the closet so that you can take care of them later.
8. Now ... MORE turn to the closet door. Go through anything that’s hanging either inside or outside the door, remove anything you no longer want to be there, and straighten up what’s left. Need to buy any hooks? Add that to your list.
If you still have time left, here are some bonus closet organization steps you can take:
9. Clothes by type. If you still have time, go back to your clothes and organize them by type (all pants together, all dresses together, etc.) and then by color. This makes it even easier to find what you’re looking for and see everything you own. (Here's more on how to sort and store clothing by type and size .)
10. Look for pieces to fix. While on step 9, look at each piece for obvious stains or rips, and to jog your memory about anything you might want to hem or have tailored. Take those things out and place them somewhere where you’ll notice them and deal with them later.
11. Accessories. If you didn’t include accessories like belts, shoes, and bags in your initial de-cluttering sweep, do them now. Place any obvious “no’s” in a bag for throwing away or donating and put shoes that need fixing in a bag to take to the cobbler. Line up all your footwear so it’s facing the same direction. Go through your bags to make sure there’s nothing gross (used tissues) or useful (money) hiding in any compartments.
12. Loose ends. Go back to your clothes and check them again, this time for things like a belt left in a pair of pants, a pin left on a jacket, or anything left in any pocket.
(Ready for more decluttering? Here are the 5 Golden Rules For Decluttering Any Space )

thread.title: Clever and Creative Ways to Store Winter Clothing
thread.title_full: Clever and Creative Ways to Store Winter Clothing

posts.author: Deirdre Sullivan
posts.title: Clever and Creative Ways to Store Winter Clothing
posts.text:
Ana Santl/Moment Open/Getty Images Storing winter clothes in a pint-sized home has its challenges. Here are some tips and tricks for packing away your out-of-season wardrobe.
01 of 04 Tip: How to Prepare Your Winter Clothing for Storing It takes a little prep work to store winter clothing correctly. Here's where to start:
Edit, edit, edit: Are you holding on to sweaters and coats you haven't worn in years? Do you have a collection of mismatched gloves and leaky boots? The latter items should be pitched. Wearable items that are in gently worn condition should be donated. Clean clothing and footwear: Your winter gear must be cleaned before storing. Soiled items that can't be washed or dry cleaned like winter shoes and ... MORE boots should be wiped or brushed. Doing so will prevent dirt from setting into your stuff. Take steps to repel pests: Prevent moths from munching on your stored sweaters with an eco-friendly moth repellent. You buy cedar, lavender or cinnamon sachets. If you prefer to DIY check out my Pinterest page. 02 of 04 Trick: Turn Winter Boots into Mini Storage Units In my home, we keep hats, gloves, and scarfs stashed in the IKEA Trones in our entryway during the winter. When spring rolls around those items are used to stuff my tall winter boots so, they keep their shape. Here's how:
Step 1: I make sure my boots are clean and dry inside and out. This chore involves brushing all the debris from the bottom and wiping down the exterior and interior of each boot.
Step 2: I place a sachet of baking soda inside each boot and let it sit for 24 hours.
Step 3: The ... MORE next day I take the sachet out and replace it with a fresh one.
Step 4: Afterward I line each boot with a thin, clean rag made from an old sheet or shirt.
Step 5: Next I stuff clean winter hats, scarfs and gloves into airtight food storage bags.
Step 6: Then I use the filled storage bags to stuff my boots.
When the task is complete, my boots are placed on a shelf in my closet. The shelf is one foot above the floor. I keep my warm weather shoes under the shelf.
03 of 04 Tip: Vacuum Pack Your Winter Gear You know those vacuum space bags that are used to compress packed clothing? I wasn't a fan for a long time because I couldn't find a great spot to store the filled bags. Then I found the garment bag version of this product. It doubled the hanging space in my closet.
Note: Space bags have a downside. When you take clothes out, they are super duper wrinkled.
Tip: Got some empty luggage? That's also a great spot to stash space bags filled with clothing. You can also utilize wasted ... MORE space with corner cabinets.
04 of 04 Trick: Rethink Where You Store Winter Clothing Think you don't have room to spare? Maybe you need to rethink your space.
Kitchen: In my last apartment I stored off-season clothing and shoes in my kitchen cabinets.
Got a bad view? In my current apartment, I have one deep windowsill that faces a brick wall in the back of my building. We covered the window with a frosted privacy film, and now we use the deep still to store off-season items including clothing, snowboard equipment, and a bicycle. A curtain conceals our smart storage solution.
Tip ... MORE : A Murphy bed is a great way to store the bed.

thread.title: Peek Inside Some Super Organized Drawers + Junk Drawers
thread.title_full: Peek Inside Some Super Organized Drawers + Junk Drawers

posts.author: Elizabeth Larkin
posts.title: Peek Inside Some Super Organized Drawers + Junk Drawers
posts.text:
01 of 10 A Neat + Tidy Home Organization Drawer Photo / Martha Stewart Living If you invite me over to your house, I will look into your junk drawer. No apologies. I find them endlessly fascinating, and most people find them endlessly frustrating to keep organized. We have several guides on the site for organizing your junk drawer and storing stuff in your junk drawers , I thought it'd also be fun to find some junk drawer organization "inspo" by peaking into the drawers of the famous, the internet famous, and even the not-so-famous to see how they create an ... MORE organized drawer.
First up: A home organization drawer from Martha Stewart (of course) keeps all of your little home organizing and storage odds + ends in one neat spot. She combines labels, with a label maker, ruler and scissors to make labeling household items easier.
Tip: Drawer organizers help to keep items separate but easily accessible.
What's in the Drawer:
Label maker Silver mesh drawer organizers Scissors + ruler Labels Stamps [ image credit ]
Continue to 2 of 10 below. 02 of 10 Organized nail polish drawer from Cupcakes and Cashmere Photo / Cupcakes and Cashmere A perfectly functional, beautiful, and organized nail polish drawer from Emily Schuman of Cupcakes and Cashmere. This follows one of my favorite organizing tips, which is to store items you use together , well, together. If you're reaching for nail polish, you are probably also reaching for a nail file and/or polish remover. There's no reason to separate these.
What's in the Drawer:
Drawer organizer Nail polishes Files Toe separaters [ image credit ]
Continue to 3 of 10 below. 03 of 10 Organized Junk Drawer from Real Simple Photo / Real Simple This is what I consider to be a classic junk drawer--but it's an organized junk drawer! Here's what we have:
Mishmosh of items Stuff you reach for all the time: scissors, pens/pencils, stamps Stuff you use infrequently but when you need it, you really need it : measuring tape, packing tape, rubber bands How can all of these varying items peacefully co-exists and look organized together?
Like items are--once again--stored with like items: tools in one spot, lightbulbs in another, sunglasses ... MORE and tools to fix sunglass in another The bamboo drawer organizer keeps everything separated but gives the drawer a cohesive look. [ image credit ]
Continue to 4 of 10 below. 04 of 10 Super Organized Baking Drawer from Martha Stewart Photo / Martha Stewart Living A super organized baking drawer, this time from Martha Stewart. First of all, how many of the same pair of scissors does Martha need? If you think this is weird, wait until you see her Japanese knife drawer (for real).
You can re-create this in your own kitchen by storing your baking supplies together under the countertop or surface where you do your baking. This way everything is in easy reach.
What's in the Drawer:
A drawer runner Baking tools Measuring cups [ image credit ]
Continue to 5 of 10 below. 05 of 10 Organized First Aid Kit Drawer from Martha Stewart Photo / Martha Stewart Living These tiny green bowls may not be the best for maximizing space but they sure look cute. This drawer is -- of course -- another from Martha Stewart. I really like the concept of keeping all of your first aid supplies in one place. I always advise readers and clients to store like items with like items so they are easier to find. First aid is perfect for this as when you need these items, you really need them and don't have time to go searching.
If you don't have an entire drawer you can ... MORE dedicate to first aid, I recommend a dedicated, labeled plastic bin stowed somewhere in your bathroom for this purpose.
[ image credit ]
Continue to 6 of 10 below. 06 of 10 Classic Cattch All Drawer Photo / Chaos to Order This classic catch-all drawer use one of the best organizing solutions for a drawer: shallow drawer dividers. This way all your odds + ends are stored together but when you have to pick out just one item you need immediately, you can spot it quickly.
Shallow drawer organizers [image credit]
Continue to 7 of 10 below. 07 of 10 Junk Drawer with Labeled Drawer Dividers Photo / The Remodeled Life Here's what I love about this blue-themed storage drawer: labels. Ten years ago I would have thought the labels were overkill, but now I know differently. Separating and then labeling the drawer organizers adds one more layer of visual organization that cuts down on the #1 question that stops people in their tracks when they're trying to stay organized:
Where should I put this!?!
Try to minimize the amount of times you need to ask yourself "Where should I put this?" in a day. ... MORE Eventually you will develop some decision fatigue and you'll be more likely to end up just shoving stuff in a drawer.
Fix:
Try labeling your junk drawer, then after 2 weeks re-asses and see if the labels are working for you.
[ image credit ]
Continue to 8 of 10 below. 08 of 10 A Colorful Junk Drawer Photo / Learnvest This colorful junk drawer using some seriously cute DIY storage options. Do you have a bunch of little bowls, saucers, tea cups and trays you've been collecting over the years? I do, and your junk drawer is a great way to put those to use.
Another option for your "littles": ice cube trays!
[ image credit ]
Continue to 9 of 10 below. 09 of 10 Super Organized All-Purpose Drawer Photo / At Home with Becky J This looks exactly like the type of all-purpose drawer I'd have at my house: packing tape and sharpie pens are things I reach for all the time. Storing them together just makes sense.
What's in the Drawer:
Batteries Hole punches Packing Tape Pens [ image credit ]
Continue to 10 of 10 below. 10 of 10 Organized baking drawer from Cupcakes and Cashmere Photo / Cupcakes and Cashmere I admire how organized this drawer is because baking supplies and decorations are some of the hardest items to store in your kitchen. I keep mine in a plastic bin, but if you have the drawer space, you can use shoe boxes to corral these items.
[ image credit ]

thread.title: Awesome Things You Never Thought You Needed for Your Apartment
thread.title_full: Awesome Things You Never Thought You Needed for Your Apartment

posts.author: Deirdre Sullivan
posts.title: Awesome Things You Never Thought You Needed for Your Apartment
posts.text:
01 of 09 Clever Stuff You Never Thought You Needed Ikea Each of these ingenious items that you never thought you needed will make life i n a small apartment or tiny house easier.
Continue to 2 of 9 below. 02 of 09 A Cheaper Way To Get Clothes Clean If you don't own a clothes washer, you know that using the pay-as-you-go machines in your building or local laundromat gets expensive fast.
The compact WonderWash is a nonelectric clothes washer that can knock out small loads in a few minutes while your . Even better, it's reasonably priced. It can pay for itself after several loads. Price: $42.95.
Continue to 3 of 9 below. 03 of 09 A Trailer For Your Bike Tired of wasting money on Zipcars or Uber whenever you need to move anything bigger than a bread box? If you have a bike you can haul almost anything without the assistance of a gas guzzling vehicle with the Bicycle Cargo Trailer by Bikes at Work . Price: starts at $600. (That's roughly the total cost of three Saturday Zipcar rentals!)
Continue to 4 of 9 below. 04 of 09 Create a Entryway Drop Zone Ikea Getting out of your apartment will become easier and faster when you create a landing strip using IKEA Trones shoe cabinets. You can use them to stash all of your grab-and-go essentials from house keys to dog leashes. A set of three costs $39.99.
Continue to 5 of 9 below. 05 of 09 A Coffee Cup That Fits in Your Pocket Sure commuter mugs are a great idea because they can prevent disposable ones from winding up in landfills. Unfortunately, they're bulky, and that makes them hard to stuff in your bag after you finished your morning brew. The Smash Cup solves that problem. When it's empty, it collapses down to a neat, compact and leak proof disc. Price: Pledge $12 to its Kickstarter campaign.
Continue to 6 of 9 below. 06 of 09 Create a Cinematic Experience Now you can make watching video on your smartphone a cinematic experience with the Cardboard Smartphone Projector . Not only does this gadget project videos from your phone to a wall, but it also amplifies the sound. Price: $26.
Continue to 7 of 9 below. 07 of 09 A Double Duty Coffee Table The Matrix Coffee Table knows up to lift things up. Since its height is adjustable, it can be used as a work surface or dining table. Price: $324 (includes shipping.)
Continue to 8 of 9 below. 08 of 09 A Terrific Toaster Oven Toaster ovens are super easy to clean and do more than crisp bread. They're also perfect for whipping up easy meals and light baking. However unlike a conventional oven, they won't heat up your entire apartment. FYI, I am a huge fan of the Breville Mini Smart Toaster. The full sized version of this toaster oven got a thumbs up from Consumer Reports. Price: $150.
Continue to 9 of 9 below. 09 of 09 An Easy Fix for a Terrible View Many of us have that one window with a sucky view. But you don't have to be stuck with it. This eco-friendly window treatment by Emma Jeffs keeps ugly views out of sight while letting in natural light. It's the perfect win-win. Price: $78 per roll.

thread.title: 10 Minute Bathroom Organization Projects
thread.title_full: 10 Minute Bathroom Organization Projects

posts.author: Elizabeth Larkin
posts.title: 10 Minute Bathroom Organization Projects
posts.text:
01 of 06 10 Minute Bathroom Organization Projects Hero Images/ Getty Images The bathroom may be small but the quick-project possibilities are endless since you store so much stuff in this space. Here are 10 minute home organization projects that will help you be a little bit more organized in your bathroom in just 10 minutes or less.
Continue to 2 of 6 below. 02 of 06 Take inventory of your toiletries and grooming supplies. Photo: Young House Love Check the contents of the following:
Hand soap Toothpaste Shampoo Conditioner Body wash Moisturizer Shaving cream Tissues Replenish anything running low from your supplies. If you're low on supplies, add it to your weekly shopping list.
Continue to 3 of 6 below. 03 of 06 Organize bathroom storage bins Photo: Mom Clarity You know I love a good project storage bin which I use to store items I use for projects (outdoor entertaining project bin is stocked with solo cups, picnic table cloth, paper plates, napkins, citronella candles, etc). Basically: I store everything I may need for projects together in one place and label them. Doesn’t this make a lot of sense in your bathroom? If you don’t have space under the bathroom sink, you can also stack these organized bins up in your linen closet.
The bathroom sink ... MORE really lends itself to project bins. Travel toiletry bin, first aid bin, fancy makeup bin (the stuff you only use on big nights out--not everyday), cold kit bin, hair care bin eye care bin, etc.
Continue to 4 of 6 below. 04 of 06 Declutter under the sink. Jake Fitzjones/ Dorling Kindersley/ Getty Images Declutter under the sink by scanning the space and then removing anything leaking, beyond it's expiration date, or showing signs of age.
Declutter under the sink by scanning the space and then removing anything leaking, beyond it's expiration date, or showing signs of age .
Continue to 5 of 6 below. 05 of 06 Declutter your bathroom countertop. Hero Images/ Getty Images Set a timer for ten minutes and declutter just your countertops:
Move laundry to the hamper, including towels that have been hanging around a few days too long Toss out garbage, move recycling to the recycling bin Put bathroom stuff back in it’s storage spaces Put everything that doesn’t belong in the bathroom in a bin Wipe down your countertop (might as well do this when everything is clear, right?) Then walk around the house with the bin and put everything back into it’s proper storage space.
Continue to 6 of 6 below. 06 of 06 Quickly clean your toothbrushes Dougal Waters/ The Image Bank/ Getty Images Here's an easy way to clean your toothbrushes:
Grab a cup, glass or mug. Dump your mouthwash --or-- make a DIY solution: dilute baking soda in vinegar and water. Soak your tooth brushes in mouthwash or the solutions for 10 minutes to as long as overnight/all day.

thread.title: How Not To Your Bedroom
thread.title_full: How Not To Feng Shui Your Bedroom

posts.author: Rodika Tchi
posts.title: How Not To Your Bedroom
posts.text:
01 of 11 9 Feng Shui Bedroom Mistakes To Avoid Astronaut Images/Getty From over 500 bedrooms I have been in (as a feng shui consultant), only a few would be considered good feng shui bedrooms and were actually conducive to a balanced and vibrant flow of love and sexual energy . Somehow the bedroom tends to be one of the most overlooked rooms in the house, while it is actually the most important room, feng shui -wise.
To make it easier to understand the main factors that create bad feng shui energy in the bedroom, I have written this quick feng shui how-to for your ... MORE bedroom that I hope you will never follow. It has a humorous tone; hope it helps you quickly learn what not to do!
Continue to 2 of 11 below. 02 of 11 Home Office in Your Bedroom Eric Raptosh Photography/Getty How To Create A Bad Feng Shui Bedroom Step # 1:
Create a home office in your bedroom. Be especially mindful of having all surfaces overflowing with papers, folders, sticky notes, and unpaid bills. If you have any old computers that do not work, it is ideal to have them in your bedroom home office . You know, in case your current computer malfunctions and you will immediately need your old broken one.
Continue to 3 of 11 below. 03 of 11 Exercise Equipment Angela Wyant/Getty How To Create A Bad Feng Shui Bedroom Step # 2:
Bring on your exercise equipment! A treadmill in your bedroom will definitely energize your love life and bring serenity and sensual energy to your bedroom. What can be more zen than that? The bigger and bulkier your exercise equipment, the better, especially if it is covered with dust because you never really use it. Excellent feng shui.
Continue to 4 of 11 below. 04 of 11 TV in Your Bedroom ZenShui/Frederic Chirou How To Create A Bad Feng Shui Bedroom Step # 3:
Bring the TV into your bedroom. A big one, placed very close to your bed. The TV is an absolute must for a bad feng shui bedroom! Watch the news for at least 30 min every night right before you go to sleep and as soon as you wake up.
Continue to 5 of 11 below. 05 of 11 Family Photos Chris Windsor/Getty How To Create A Bad Feng Shui Bedroom Step # 4:
Display a big collection of photos of ALL your friends and family , ideally from several generations, to "watch over your love life". After all, why would you need privacy in your bedroom?
Continue to 6 of 11 below. 06 of 11 Old Memorabilia John Slater/Getty How To Create A Bad Feng Shui Bedroom Step # 5:
Store under your bed the old memorabilia from all your past relationships, especially the sad ones. Tuck all those important reminders really tight so there is no breathing room left under your bed , and then tuck some more.
Continue to 7 of 11 below. 07 of 11 Drury Colors Cultura RM\Philipp Nemenz How To Create A Bad Feng Shui Bedroom Step # 6:
Decorate your bedroom in depressing, sad colors. For a splash of color , get creative with your Halloween costumes and accessories here and there, or a touch of that special green from last year's St. Patrick's party.
Continue to 8 of 11 below. 08 of 11 Dying Plants Patrick Struttner/Getty How To Create A Bad Feng Shui Bedroom Step # 7:
Bring all your dying plants, big and small, be it in chipped pots or yogurt containers. Your bedroom is the place to have them! Position the plants so that you can see them first thing when you wake up and the last thing before you go to sleep. Might be a bit of a competition here from either the TV, the computer(s) or the exercise equipment, but stay focused and do your best!
Continue to 9 of 11 below. 09 of 11 Lack of Balance Aylin Saglam/Getty How To Create A Bad Feng Shui Bedroom Step # 8:
Forget about two bedside tables, and have your bed against the wall. Gracefully place one cheerful Winnie the Pooh pillow on top of your bed . Position the pillow so that it faces the door and greets you every time you come in. Instant feng shui to boost your love life!
Continue to 10 of 11 below. 10 of 11 No Fresh Energy Bad feng shui in the bedroom will repel the energy of love away from you. Be smart and feng shui your bedroom well. Asia Images / Getty How To Create A Bad Feng Shui Bedroom Step # 9:
Do not open the windows or let the natural light in!. Keep the energy as stale as possible. After all, who says your personal energy is connected to the energy around you? Stop talking about energy. Far out, man!
Continue to 11 of 11 below. 11 of 11 Make A Choice (c) jillianharris.com A couple of Mandarin ducks is ALL you need to make you love life work, right? Now if you just find the right place to display them, then your soulmate , along with the happily ever after, will be here in no time. No kidding. Really?
Ok, so if this does not sound attractive to you (I much hope it doesn't!) here are some good feng shui tips to apply in your bedroom.
Continue Reading: 7 Steps To Create Good Feng Shui in Your Bedroom

thread.title: 10 Worst Bed Headboards
thread.title_full: 10 Worst Feng Shui Bed Headboards

posts.author: Rodika Tchi
posts.title: 10 Worst Bed Headboards
posts.text:
01 of 11 Intro Jonathan D. Goforth/Getty Images A good feng shui headboard is one of the crucial elements of a good feng shui bed . A good headboard will create strong and supportive energy for your bed, which provides for better sleep, as well as an overall sense of being supported in life.
A weak headboard - or an absence of a headboard altogether - will do the opposite. Feng shui -wise, a weak headboard cannot provide you with the energy of support and stability that we all need. And if that sounds strange, think how much time we spend in ... MORE bed!
We are being so mindful about choosing chairs and sofas with good backing (for obvious reasons), but when it comes to a more subtle energetic backing and support, most of us are unaware of the importance of a good feng shui headboard.
To help you understand what makes a good feng shui headboard, we've actually created a gallery of bad feng shui headboards. Yes, knowing what to avoid sometimes makes it very easy to know what to go for!
Let's look at 10 worst feng shui headboards.
Continue to 2 of 11 below. 02 of 11 White Metal Headboard Philippa Michael/Getty Images Metal headboards are considered undesirable feng shui for many reasons. The first, and most obvious reason is that metal is cold to the touch/has cold energy, and feng shui wise this is not the energy you want in your bed! EMF -wise, metal also tends to have residual magnetism and can even act as a giant antennae (sources: electricsense.com and emfs.com ). Knowing how polluted our bedrooms are with high EMFs, it is wise to avoid a metal headboard in your bedroom .
Now that you know more about the ... MORE energy of a metal headboard, no matter how pretty this white and feminine headboard looks it is still a bad feng shui headboard. In addition, this headboard also has a very weak energy, basically providing no energetic backing.
Continue to 3 of 11 below. 03 of 11 Wood Spindles Headboards Image Source/Getty Images While wooden headboards are certainly much better than the metal ones, the design of the headboard is as important as its material. All designs that create "energetic holes" or have considerable empty spaces within the space of the headboard are considered weak and not good feng shui . This headboard style is definitely one of them. In addition, this specific design just looks boring and dated, don't you agree?
Continue to 4 of 11 below. 04 of 11 Custom Made Headboard Andreas Von Einsiedel/Getty Images This particular headboard design might look quite dramatic, as well as clever, considering the positioning of the bed (notice what's happening behind the headboard). However, dramatic and clever is not enough for good feng shui. The energy of this headboard is scattered in pieces, and mirrors the squares on the nearby wall, which makes it even weaker.
A good feng shui headboard is always a headboard that serves as a focal point , rather than mirrors other design elements in the bedroom , especially ... MORE the elements that are similar in size. The energy of this headboard is scattered and weak; it's the energy of many pieces floating around with no strength, focus or support.
Continue to 5 of 11 below. 05 of 11 Modern Metal Spindles Headboard Abode/Getty Images Here is another metal headboard that combines two of the worst features, feng shui -wise. it is made from metal (and we've already covered why metal headboards are not good feng shui) and it has one of the worst designs - the metal spindles that can bring to mind either hospital or prison beds. Yes, this particular design is visually way more pleasing and modern than the one we looked at before, but the energy of it is still the same - weak and unsupportive.
Continue to 6 of 11 below. 06 of 11 Black Headboard with Storage PNC/Getty Images Headboards with storage are never a good idea. Beds with storage in general are considered bad feng shui, and a headboard with storage or display windows like the one pictured here is even worse. It can easily turn into a feng shui nightmare. Displaying or hanging anything above your bed - especially above your head - is really bad feng shui, let alone just does nor make sense energetically. What would you place on that headboard - a vase, a couple books, a photo? What if they all just fall? ... MORE This design is really bad feng shui and defeats the purpose of a good feng shui headboard - to provide energetic strength, support and calm.
Continue to 7 of 11 below. 07 of 11 Tall Wooden Headboard with Spindles Adobe/Getty Images Here is a headboard design that might look visually pleasing, even beautiful, but energetically it is really weak. The combination of height and spindles design, plus the low positioning of the mattress, creates an unsettling energy that is by no means supportive or nourishing.
Continue to 8 of 11 below. 08 of 11 Low Headboard with Storage webphotographeer/Getty Images Here is another headboard that, even though with a solid backing - always good feng shui! - it also has storage, which is a pretty bad feature for a bed. Storing things under the bed, or behind the bed, as in this case, creates stagnant and often confusing energy. Why would you want this energy in your bedroom ?
Continue to 9 of 11 below. 09 of 11 Upholstered Divided Headboard Camilo Morales/Getty Images This headboard design looks visually pleasing, and it is upholstered, too, which in most cases creates an excellent feng shui headboard. However, notice it is divided in two. And yes, you might think this is not that big of a deal, but energetically it is. An ideal feng shui headboard creates strength and provides good backing for the bed, which in turn promotes the energy of unity. This is the energy you want in your bed and in your relationship, isn't it? United, not divided.
Continue to 10 of 11 below. 10 of 11 Ornate Metal Headboard Abode/Getty Images Here is a headboard that looks beautiful, visually pleasing and even uplifting in a royal kind of way. And it's also not good feng shui. Apart from the fact that it is a metal headboard - and all metal headboards create "not-so-good" feng shui in the bedroom - it also has an energy and movement that is more suited for a throne rather than a bed. What makes a good feng shui bed, you might ask? Good question!
Read: 3 Things That Make a Good Feng Shui Bed
Continue to 11 of 11 below. 11 of 11 Modern Wooden Headboard Tammy Hanratty/Getty Images And here is another bad feng shui headboard. It looks nice, doesn't it? However, by now you have learned that "nice" is not always good feng shui, if the energy that is created by a particular headboard cannot provide energetic support and strength. This headboard is one of those cases - it's good looking, attractive, modern. It can bring character and warmth to any modern bedroom. And, it is not good feng shui .
Notice how it creates empty spaces - energetic holes - that promote the leakage of ... MORE energy. There is no continuous solidity or a sense of energetic support in this headboard, so it is definitely a headboard design to avoid.
This concludes our exploration of bad feng shui headboards; now you have the eyes to distinguish between the good and the bad ones!
Continue Reading: 6 Worst Feng Shui Bed Placements

thread.title: Use To Clear Your Home's Clutter
thread.title_full: Use Feng Shui To Clear Your Home's Clutter

posts.author: Rodika Tchi
posts.title: Use To Clear Your Home's Clutter
posts.text:
01 of 06 Use Feng Shui To Clear Your Clutter ULTRA F/Getty Images If you think the time to clear your clutter is not time well spent, let me change your mind by using basic feng shui wisdom. It will be really easy. Using feng shui to clear your clutter can actually be a very exciting process once you understand what clutter does to your life and to your home .
Clutter is low, stagnant, and confusing energy that constantly drains energy from you. Depending on the feng shui area of your home where your clutter is located, it can also negatively influence, or even ... MORE completely block, the flow of energy and events in many areas of your life.
Continue to 2 of 6 below. 02 of 06 Do You Avoid Clearing Your Clutter? Getty Images The reason most people avoid clearing the clutter is not because it takes effort and it can be time consuming. The real reason is the fact that clutter clearing is a very emotional process that feels like therapy, so yes, it takes emotional stamina to go through it. I wrote about an easy clutter clearing system that takes you step by step without draining your energy, check it out and give it a try, I am sure you will benefit from it and enjoy excellent results!
Read: The Best Feng Shui Clutter ... MORE Clearing System EVER
Once you clear most of your clutter with feng shui and have a clear system to avoid its accumulation in the future, you will start experiencing high energy levels, more clarity, and a heightened sense of well-being . Wouldn't you agree this is definitely worth the hard work and the extra effort it takes to apply feng shui to clear your clutter?
Here are the 3 main areas I recommend you start clearing your clutter with feng shui.
Continue to 3 of 6 below. 03 of 06 1. Clutter in Your Bedroom Angela Wyant/Getty We are most influenced by things, events, and people that are closest to us, so it is absolutely logical (and highly advisable) to first start applying feng shui to clear the clutter in your bedroom .
Take out all the items that create visual (and energetic/ EMF ) clutter and do not really belong in the bedroom. This includes the TV, any exercise equipment, office/work related items, storage items, etc. Clear the clutter under the bed . Thoroughly de-clutter and clean your closets . Let go of as many ... MORE items as possible that you have not used in a long time. Continue to 4 of 6 below. 04 of 06 2. Clutter in Your Kitchen Ian Nolan/Getty Images In feng shui, the state of your kitchen is the state of your health, especially the state of your liver. Liver is the main detoxifying organ in the body. So do your liver and your health a big favor and clean up and de-clutter that kitchen!
De-clutter the refrigerator. Clean the stove and all the pots and pans. Let go of all harsh chemical cleaners from the kitchen and go for natural ones. Clean out all the drawers, surfaces, light fixtures, etc. Continue to 5 of 6 below. 05 of 06 3. Clutter in Your Main Entry (c) Oliver Gruener Your front entrance is the way your house gets its energy nourishment. In feng shui, the front door is called the mouth of Chi , or energy. Upon the entrance to every space your energy is looking for grounding and focus, so do treat your senses respectfully and provide for a visual relief.
Let go of any objects in your main door area that are not really needed there, such as the recycle bins in full view, chipped pots, etc. Find a way to deal with all the incoming mail so that it does not take over ... MORE the space. A small drawer in the closet may be a solution if the space is limited in the entryway area. Keep only the in-season items in your main entry closet. Bring a sense of beauty to your main entry , as in feng shui the state of your main entry determines the quality of Chi, or energy, that later circulates throughout your house. Continue to 6 of 6 below. 06 of 06 Easy Feng Shui To Clear Your Clutter Alison Gootee/Getty Images Focus on these three areas, as they are most strongly connected to your well-being at home. Clarify, purify and let go. Create a fresh pathway for strong vibrant Chi to flow into your home and into your life.
Continue Reading: Clear Your Clutter with this Easy Feng Shui System

thread.title: Choosing the Right Good Luck Charm
thread.title_full: Choosing the Right Feng Shui Good Luck Charm

posts.author: Rodika Tchi
posts.title: Choosing the Right Good Luck Charm
posts.text:
01 of 08 Horseshoe for Good Luck The use of a horseshoe as a protective and good luck symbol goes back many centuries, so yes, it is good feng shui to have it in your home. The iron horseshoe has a long history as a powerful good luck charm in most Western countries, as well as in India.
How To Use the Lucky Horseshoe Compare Online Prices for the Lucky Horseshoe Continue to 2 of 8 below. 02 of 08 Dzi Beads as a Good Luck Charm (c) DziofTibet.com Dzi beads are considered a good luck charm by most feng shui practitioners. The origin of Dzi beads is a mystery, but they were probably made by ancient people from agate by carving specific markings on the stone. You can find all sorts of designs on Dzi beads, from circles to stripes, squares , waves and more.
The image of the eye has always been a very powerful symbol in all ancient cultures. The eye is vigilant, all-seeing and protective, thus the wearer of jewelry with the eye design is ... MORE considered to be protected by its vigilance.
How To Use Dzi Beads for Good Luck Continue to 3 of 8 below. 03 of 08 The Lucky Cat Brings Good Luck Paul Burns / Getty Images The Japanese name for the Lucky cat is Maneki Neko, which translates as the Beckoning Cat. The lucky cat is mostly used in businesses, but you can also use it in your home, or even carry it with you. There are numerous items on the market with the lucky cat image - from t-shirts to key chains.
How To Use the Lucky Cat Charm Compare Online Prices for the Lucky Cat Continue to 4 of 8 below. 04 of 08 The Laughing Buddha - Much Good Luck! (c) Exoticindiaart.com There are few feng shui cures as popular - and as universal in their application - as the Laughing Buddha . Used as a feng shui cure for good luck, abundance , happiness, success, good health, in other words, for everything good!
The Use of the Laughing Buddha Compare Online Prices for the Laughing Buddha Continue to 5 of 8 below. 05 of 08 Double Happiness Sign for Good Luck (c) Queenberry Inc There is perfect symmetry, flow and balance in the Chinese double happiness sign , which speaks of the possibility of a lasting harmonious energy in a love relationship. Can there be a better charm to attract good luck in love and marriage?
How To Use the Double Happiness Sign Continue to 6 of 8 below. 06 of 08 Pi Yao (Pi Xiu) for Good Luck (c) Joy's Lim / Weemall.com To a feng shui beginner, a Pi Yao can look very similar to a Fu Dog, as well as to a Chi Lin. Just like the Chi Lin, the Pi Yao (Pi Xiu) can be used either alone or in pairs. Pi Xiu has many uses in a good feng shui home or office. And, of course, a very popular use of Pi Yao is as a personal amulet, such as a bracelet or a key chain.
About the Use of Pi Yao, or Pi Xiu Continue to 7 of 8 below. 07 of 08 Lucky Bamboo for Good Luck (c) Northernsun.com The Lucky Bamboo is one of the most popular feng shui cures. Used both at home and at the office, it can bring the desired good luck energy according to the specific number of its stalks. Can't find a place for your lucky bamboo at home or at the office? Find it in art, or even wear its image in clothing!
All About the Use of Lucky Bamboo Continue to 8 of 8 below. 08 of 08 Elephant Symbol for Good Luck (c) Tarina Tarantino When it comes to the feng shui energy and symbology of the elephant, few people can object to its beauty, silent power, kindness, and majesty. Protection , good luck, and fertility are the main feng shui energies brought by the symbol of the elephant.
About the Elephant Use in Feng Shui Compare Online Prices for Elephant Charms

thread.title: Easy Guide To Your Best Bedroom Colors
thread.title_full: Easy Feng Shui Guide To Your Best Bedroom Colors

posts.author: Rodika Tchi
posts.title: Easy Guide To Your Best Bedroom Colors
posts.text:
01 of 12 Here's Your Color Guide (c) immyandindi.com.au Are you wondering which colors can bring best feng shui energy to your bedroom? No matter if you are single or in a relationship, the energy in your bedroom has quite a bit of power over your health, as well as the flow of love in your life (both self-love, as well as romantic love).
We've all been impressed with glossy magazines showing beautiful bedrooms in all sorts of colors - from deep forest green to bright magenta and even dark charcoal color. Are these good feng shui colors for your be ... MORE droom, though? Apart from visually being very impressive, do they actually bring good energy to you and your home ?
Let's have a look at best feng shui bedroom colors in general, as well as best colors for your very own bedroom.
Continue to 2 of 12 below. 02 of 12 Good Bedroom Colors Overall (c) alisaburke.blogspot.ca Even though we generally respond the same way to color - i.e yellow ​color is happy, blue is calming, etc - choosing a good color for your bedroom might not be easy. Not only because what you see on the color swatch will usually look very different on your wall, but also because there are many surrounding elements in your bedroom that have to welcome and "accept" the color into their own world.
Feng shui makes it easy because it has very clear general guidelines for best bedroom colors. When in ... MORE doubt, you can always go for skin color tones and know that this is good feng shui. And as skin color tones vary from pure white to rich chocolate brown tones, you have quite a wide range to play with!
However, feng shui also goes deeper - when​ you are ready to go deeper! - and helps you choose a bedroom color that will also promote a good, harmonious quality of energy in your whole home.
Continue to 3 of 12 below. 03 of 12 Feng Shui Bagua Colors (c) How To Define Your Bagua Video (youtube.com/rodikatchi) Another way to choose a color in order to promote overall harmony in your home is by honoring the energetic needs of each bagua area. If you are new to feng shui, know that a bagua area is a specific area in your house usually defined by the compass direction of the front door .
This can get quite complex, so we highly encourage you to explore the concept of bagua more. If you are want to understand the feng shui bagua of your home, this will help you:
All About Your Feng ... MORE Shui Bagua
However, we also made it easy for you, so if you know the compass direction where your bedroom is located, we have the best feng shui colors for you!
Continue to 4 of 12 below. 04 of 12 East Area Bedroom Colors (c) bhg.com A bedroom in the East area of the house (also called the Health & Family bagua area) gives you plenty of color choices. Why? Because in feng shui the best choice of color is based on the play of 5 feng shui elements , and in case of an East area bedroom there are 3 elements that bring good energy to it.
You can choose the colors of Wood, Earth and Water feng shui elements for your bedroom, which basically means you can go for any shades of green and brown ( Wood element) , a variety of earthy colors ... MORE ( Earth element ) and colors blue and black ( Water element ).
Continue to 5 of 12 below. 05 of 12 Southeast Area Bedroom Colors (c) bhg.com A bedroom in the Southeast area benefits from the same colors as a bedroom in the East area because they share the same feng shui element requirements. So you can choose from a variety of colors that can create good feng shui in this area - green and brown for the Wood feng shui element, black and blue for the Water element and all earthy tones for the Earth element.
Because the Southeast area is strongly connected to the flow of abundance in your life, you can consider decorating it with the ... MORE intent of attracting the ​ energy of wealth into your life. Look at the variety of feng shui wealth cures and see which ones can work seamlessly with your bedroom decor. Just remember that a water feature - or representations of actual water - are not good feng shui for the bedroom, even if your bedroom is located in the ​​ wealth area.
Continue to 6 of 12 below. 06 of 12 South Area Bedroom Colors (c) bhg.com South area is connected to the energy of fame and reputation in feng shui (a more exact translation is "the light within"). The element that needs to be nourished in this area is the Fire element , so if your bedroom is in the South feng shui bagua area then best colors for it are the colors of the Fire element (red, pink, orange, purple, magenta, yellow), as well as the colors of the Wood element (green and brown).
Continue to 7 of 12 below. 07 of 12 Southwest Area Bedroom Colors (c) bhg.com A bedroom in the Southwest bagua area is quite easy to decorate and apply feng shui to, as this area is connected to the energy of love and marriage . So any art or decor elements that speak to you of love and romance are excellent here both because this bagua area is strengthened by the visual representations of love energy, as well as because any bedroom in any bagua area is strengthened, energetically speaking, by tokens of love and togetherness.
Color-wise, the Fire and Earth element colors ... MORE are excellent here, so you can pick any (or all) of the following: red, orange , yellow, purple, pink , magenta, and all earthy tones .​
Continue to 8 of 12 below. 08 of 12 West Area Bedroom Colors (c) lindsaymarcella.com The West bagua area is connected to the energy of creativity and children . Even though you would think this will invite all sorts of wild colors, feng shui-wise the best colors here are white and grays, as well as all earthy tones. Why? Simply because the governing feng shui element of this area is Metal, and white and gray are the colors that express this element. The colors of the Earth feng shui element are also excellent here because this element is very nurturing to Metal. So all earthy ... MORE tones are also excellent in a West area bedroom.
Continue to 9 of 12 below. 09 of 12 Northwest Area Bedroom Colors (c) halemercantileco.com via estliving.com Best colors for a Northwest area bedroom are the same as the colors for a West bedroom as they share the same governing element of Metal . So, you can pick and choose from white and gray , as well as all earthy tones. Be mindful to limit a strong presence of fiery colors as the element of Fire is damaging to the Metal element.
Continue to 10 of 12 below. 10 of 12 North Area Bedroom Colors (c) bhg.com A bedroom in the North area can be a bit difficult to decorate, feng shui-wise, just because the best colors for this area are not the best colors for the bedroom. The Water feng shui element that governs this area is expressed in blue and black colors, and it takes quite a skill to have these colors in the bedroom without creating a slightly depressed feeling. It's not impossible, but it is difficult. However, you can go for the colors of the Metal element because this is the element that ... MORE supports Water in feng shui, so colors white and gray are excellent for a North area bedroom, too.
Continue to 11 of 12 below. 11 of 12 Northeast Area Bedroom Colors Spencer Gordon/Getty Images The Northeast area is connected to one's spiritual growth and cultivation and the governing feng shui element of this area is Earth. So, if you have a bedroom in the Northeast area of your house , the best colors for it are the Earth element colors (all earthy tones) as well as the colors of the Fire element (red, orange, yellow, pink, purple and magenta).
Continue to 12 of 12 below. 12 of 12 Conclusion (c) styleathome.com So there you have it, all the best feng shui bedroom colors for all bedrooms - from a North to a South bedroom! Of course, there is much more to a than just the choice of color, and we have a variety of resources to help you out with any bedroom decor dilemmas - from how to place your bed for good feng shui to how to create a bedroom to attract love. ​
Continue Reading: 100+ Bedroom Feng Shui Tips

thread.title: Salt Water Cure: How To Make, Use,and Dispose
thread.title_full: Feng Shui Salt Water Cure: How To Make, Use,and Dispose

posts.author: Rodika Tchi
posts.title: Salt Water Cure: How To Make, Use,and Dispose
posts.text:
01 of 06 Feng Shui Salt Water Cure Step by Step Oxana Denezhkina/Getty If you've read all about the popular and powerful feng shui salt water cure , you know that it can help remove negative energy from your home (or office).
Here are the instructions to help you make your own salt water cure, as well as tips for its best feng shui placement in your home. You will also find out when and how to dispose your salt water cure. Let's start.
Continue to 2 of 6 below. 02 of 06 Items You Need for the Salt Water Cure (c) fengshuibestbuy.com Here are the items you need to make your own salt water cure:
- Salt (ideally high quality rock salt)
- One Container (glass, porcelain or metal)
- 6 Chinese Coins (made from brass)
- Water (to fill 3/4 of your chosen container)
- A protective mat, or a stand.
Continue to 3 of 6 below. 03 of 06 Step By Step Instructions Lane Oatey/Blue Jean Images/Getty
Step #1 . Fill your chosen container with salt up to 3/4 of its capacity.
Step #2. Place the 6 Chinese coins on top of the salt; the coins should be placed with the Yang side up ( the side with the four Chinese characters ).
Step #3. Add water to fill the container to the top.
Step #4 . Place the container on a protective mat, or on a stand in the home area where you most need it.
Step #5 . The salt water cure container should be left open, so be sure not to cover it or place it in a covered space, such ... MORE as a kitchen cupboard, for example.
Continue to 4 of 6 below. 04 of 06 Tips for the Best Placement of Your Feng Shui Salt Water Cure Carina Gran/Getty Place your salt water cure in an area where you know the container will be safe, meaning it will not be tipped over, moved or otherwise tampered with. Usually a room corner works well.
If you do not like the look of the salt water cure (it will change even more in time); be sure to place it behind a decor object so that your feng shui cure is not visible. For example, you can have your salt water cure behind the sofa, a screen or a big lush plant .
You should be able to have easy access to your ... MORE salt water cure in order to add water as needed.
Continue to 5 of 6 below. 05 of 06 When and How To Dispose Your Salt Water Cure (c) fengshuibestbuy.com Because the feng shui salt water cure will absorb and accumulate a lot of negative energy, care should be taken with its disposal. Do not cleanse the bowl and the coins, but rather properly discard the whole cure.
In some homes this cure needs to be replaced every couple of months, and in other homes just once or twice a year is enough. Keep an eye on your salt water cure, and it if looks like it has done a lot of work (like the one pictured above), then replace it with a new one.
Traditionally, ... MORE the Chinese New Year is always the time to place a new salt water cure, or to replace the existing one.
Continue to 6 of 6 below. 06 of 06 The Use of Your Salt Water Cure (c) quantumbalancing.com The feng shui salt water cure is usually used in tandem with other metal cures, because the ill effects of the annual feng shui stars #2, #3 and #5 are destroyed by metal. So, feng shui cures such as a 6 hollow metal rod wind chime, a metal Wu Lou (Chinese gourd) or metal bowls are often used in addition to the salt water cure in order to achieve best results.
The use of number 6 - as in the number of Chinese coins for the salt water cure, as well as the number of metal rods in the wind chime - ... MORE is based on the fact that in feng shui, 6 is considered to be a number with a strong metal essence. If you look at the feng shui bagua with the I Ching trigrams on it, you will see number 6 in the Chi'en trigram, a metal feng shui element trigram.
So this is all you need to know in order to create (and benefit from!) the feng shui salt water cure! It is easy to make and it does work wonders, just take good care of it.
Continue Reading: How To Smudge Your Home in 5 Easy Steps

thread.title: Traditional Chinese Cure - Protective Chi Lin
thread.title_full: Traditional Chinese Feng Shui Cure - Protective Chi Lin

posts.author: Rodika Tchi
posts.title: Traditional Chinese Cure - Protective Chi Lin
posts.text:
01 of 12 Bejeweled Chi Lin Chi Lin, the Dragon Horse, is a classical feng shui protection cure
Chi Lin is a mythical Chinese creature with the head of a Dragon, the body of a Horse, and the scales of a Carp fish. Also called the Dragon Horse, or the Chinese Unicorn, Chi Lin brings strong, protective feng shui energy with blessings of good health and prosperity . Chi Lin is very loyal to its owner and will protect the house from evil spirits. Chi Lin has higher royal status that other feng shui guardians.
You can benefit from ... MORE the energy of this feng shui guardian in many ways - bring a small sculpture into your home , choose an embroidery with Chi Lin image, a feng shui tassel, or carry Chi Lin with you as a key chain. You can place the Chi Lin near the main entrance , in the family or living room. Do not place the Chi Lin in your bedroom, kitchen or bathroom.
As with most traditional feng shui cures, Chi Lin comes in many materials, colors , finishes and sizes.
Next: Gold Chi Lin with Red Ribbons and Chinese Coins
Find it online
This Golden Chi Lin blows cosmic chi to benefit the space and protect it from unwanted energies - evil spirits. Its protective power and auspiciousness is further activated by the red color jewels that is a very auspicious feng shui color. This particular Chi Lin is also a strong metal feng shui element cure, thus it can be further used to counteract the inauspicious annual flying stars. It is considered to be the most desired of all Chi Lins and is often recommended by classical feng shui masters.
Continue to 2 of 12 below. 02 of 12 Colorful Feng Shui Chi Lin Couple Find it online
Many traditional feng shui practitioners affirm that the Chi Lin should always be used alone, while some recommend using them as a couple. This colorful feng shui Chi Lin couple has bright and an overall protective energy.
Continue to 3 of 12 below. 03 of 12 Chi Lin Wind Chime Chi Lin Wind Chime - Powerful Feng Shui Cure for Protection. Photo: (c) Buy-FengShui.com. Find it online
Windchimes have a variety of uses in feng shui , depending on their size, material, symbols, design, etc, etc. This 6 rod feng shui Chi Lin windchime will bring strong protection when used as a Metal feng shui cure, as 6 is a metal feng shui element number.
Continue to 4 of 12 below. 04 of 12 Brass Chi Lin Couple Find it online
This beautiful couple of Chi Lins can be used both outside, as well as inside.
Continue to 5 of 12 below. 05 of 12 Blue Chi Lin with Treasures for Wealth Find it online
A beautiful classical feng shui Chi Lin tassel that is best used as a cure to attract wealth and abundance. You can use it in your money area or in your lucky direction for wealth.
Continue to 6 of 12 below. 06 of 12 Bronze Chi Lins Find it online
If you have a couple thousand dollars to spend, these hand forged bronze Chi Lins can sure add not only a feng shui sense of protection, but also a touch of beauitful art.
Continue to 7 of 12 below. 07 of 12 Feng Shui Chi Lin, the Chinese Dragon Horse Find it online
Gorgeous Chi Lins for any space that can accommodate their energy.
Continue to 8 of 12 below. 08 of 12 Feng Shui Tassel with Protective Chi Lin Find it online
If you are into traditional Chinese feng shui tassels, this can be a good Chi Lin cure for you.
Continue to 9 of 12 below. 09 of 12 Chi Lin with Scholastic Objects Find it online
This Chi Lin with four scholastic objects is used as a feng shui cure to help one advance in his or her studies or for professional career advancement.
Continue to 10 of 12 below. 10 of 12 Chi Lin Charm for Malevolent Annual Stars Find it online
The 3 Chi Lins charm is mostly used to counteract the effects of the negative feng shui annual stars.
Continue to 11 of 12 below. 11 of 12 Chi Lin Feng Shui Amulet Find it online
You can carry the protective feng shui enegry of the Chi Lin with this feng shui amulet. Smart and easy!
Continue to 12 of 12 below. 12 of 12 Chi Lin Key Chain - Portable Feng Shui for Protection and Good Luck Find it online
Protection, ambition, perseverance and good fortune - these are the energies of the Chi Lin keychain. Even though small in size, you can still see the scales of carp to assure good luck in financial matters. This Chi Lin keychain has energies that will protect its owner from bad luck and help attract good fortune .

You can use many traditional Chinese feng shui cures, such as the Dragon, the Horse, the Ru Yi and many others. You can also create your own, more powerful feng shui symbols once you understand the feng shui guidelines needed to create a specific feng shui energy.
Let's start ... MORE with: The Use of the Feng Shui Horse Symbol for Career Success

This powerful feng shui symbol is often used in the Fame area of the Bagua (South), as well as in the Career area (North). If your Chinese zodiac sign is the Horse, you can also place this symbol in your lucky direction for success.
Read: 3 Feng Shui Tips for the Use of the Horse Symbol
Continue to 3 of 7 below. 03 of 07 Fire Feng Shui Element Decor in the South Area phototropic / Getty Images How do you bring a strong presence of the fire feng shui element when you need it? You can choose from a variety of fire feng shui element expressions - from candles and colors to shapes and specific images.

Continue to 4 of 7 below. 04 of 07 Water Element Decor in the North Feng Shui Area via decorallure.blogspot.ca A strong presence of the water feng shui element can be brought into the North bagua area with such popular decor items as fountains , tall vases or mirrors . To strengthen your career energy, you can also display many career-related images - ideally in black and white colors - in this feng shui area.
Read: How To Decorate with the Water Feng Shui Element
Continue to 5 of 7 below. 05 of 07 Feng Shui Dragon as A Success Symbol Wesley Van Dinter/Getty The feng shui dragon symbol is a powerful and auspicious traditional feng shui cure, as well as an excellent feng shui symbol of strong yang /male energy. A pearl, or a crystal, in the feng shui dragon's claw symbolizes wealth , power and an abundance of opportunities.

Continue to 6 of 7 below. 06 of 07 Ru Yi as A Symbol of Power BJI / Blue Jean Images / Getty Images Literally translated, Ru Yi means as you wish and as such, Ru Yi has become a feng shui good luck and good fortune symbol. It is often used in offices as a symbol of power and success. Should you use Ru Yi as a helpful feng shui career success cure? Continue to 7 of 7 below. 07 of 07 Apply Feng Shui in Your Office Thomas-Barwick/Getty After exploring a variety of feng shui cures for success - both modern, as well as classical feng shui cures - we have come to one of the most important steps you can take to attract career success. Yes, this step is obviously to create good feng shui in your workspace!
Explore these easy office feng shui tips to create vibrant and successful energy in your office space.
