thread.title: 7 Styling Tips for an Elegant Mantel Display
thread.title_full: 7 Styling Tips for an Elegant Mantel Display

posts.author: Sam Schriemer
posts.title: 7 Styling Tips for an Elegant Mantel Display
posts.text:
01 of 07 7 Styling Tips for an Elegant Mantel Display Luis Laplace There is just something magical about a fireplace . We all daydream about spending time curled up by a crackling fire, and even when it's not lit, a fireplace is generally the focal point of a room. If you’re lucky enough to have a space with a fireplace, most of the time, that fireplace will include some sort of mantel. Though they're often not very large, the beauty of a mantel is that it adds another styleable space at the very heart of your room. A well-styled mantel helps elevate the ... MORE look of a fireplace while completing the aesthetic statement of the entire room. Because they command so much attention, mantels are the ideal places to display your very favorite works of art and photography as well as the most captivating pieces of any collection. To help you turn your mantel into the crowning achievement of your favorite room, we’ve put together seven tips that will help make styling the perfect mantel an absolute breeze.
Continue to 2 of 7 below. 02 of 07 Use Mirrors La Dolce Vita It may seem a little obvious, but mirrors are one of the best objects to use when styling your mantel. A single mirror is able to achieve so much. It creates a focal point, adds some height, and really helps to open up the space.
[ Image Credit ]
Continue to 3 of 7 below. 03 of 07 Create Visual Layers SF Girl By Bay Try layering art and photographs on top of one another to accomplish a deep, sophisticated look that is truly unique to your space. Don’t worry about things being perfectly balanced or symmetrical. Simply play around with your art and images until you create a look that feels right. By mixing and matching you’ll create a mantel display that feels organic and effortless.
[ Image Credit ]
Continue to 4 of 7 below. 04 of 07 Display Fresh Greenery All The King's Houses Displaying fresh greenery and flowers is a fantastic way to bring the outdoors in. Not only does greenery help wake up the mantel with lively organic color, it also adds some unique texture that can be hard to achieve with other decorative objects.
[ Image Credit ]
Continue to 5 of 7 below. 05 of 07 Add Height to Your Mantel We Heart It When styling your mantel, be sure to add objects that draw the eye upwards. Items like mirrors, art, sculptures, and photography that can be blown up to really large sizes are all great options. Without some sort of vertical visual, the space above your mantel can seem empty, making it hard for your mantel to compete with the interest of the fireplace below.
[ Image Credit ]
Continue to 6 of 7 below. 06 of 07 Use Contrasting Colors DustJacket Nothing makes a statement like using bold and contrasting colors when decorating your mantel. Decorating with flowers and ceramics are a great way to add a pop of color to the area. Try pairing soft, neutral colors like pinks, creams, grays, and whites, with bold blues, emerald greens, and cherry reds.
[ Image Credit ]
Continue to 7 of 7 below. 07 of 07 Keep Objects to the Side Renaissance London As exciting as it can be to load up the mantel with great pieces, you don’t need to cover your entire mantel with objects for it to look styled and complete. In fact, try adding a few objects on just the left and right sides of the mantel. With this kind of selective styling, you’re able to create a beautiful and more dramatic focal point.
[ Image Credit ]

thread.title: Winter Activities for Kids Looking to Beat Cabin Fever
thread.title_full: Winter Activities for Kids Looking to Beat Cabin Fever

posts.author: Apryl Duncan
posts.title: Winter Activities for Kids Looking to Beat Cabin Fever
posts.text:
Families tend to hibernate when the temperatures get colder, but there's plenty of winter fun for children and parents to enjoy together. You'll forget all about the winter blahs with these winter activities for kids looking to beat those cabin fever blues.
01 of 12 Play Snow Games Snow games are always fun winter activities for kids. Photo © ImagesBazaar / Getty Images You don't have to tell kids to go outside and play in the snow. Try shaking up their snowsuits with winter activities that include a snowy hike, outdoor hockey or a frosty game of frisbee. No white stuff where you live? Make fake snow so your kids can experience the same winter fun as their northern neighbors.
02 of 12 Trace Your Family Tree Photo © Image Source / Getty Images Help the kids learn about their family roots . They can interview you, their grandparents and other family members to hear the names and stories of people who've helped make them who they are today. Filling in the names on the family tree branches can keep their interest long after snowmen have melted and winter is gone.
03 of 12 Watch a Family Movie at Home Turn your living room into a movie theater, complete with tickets, a concession stand and movie reviews. Photo © Maskot / Getty Images One of your family's favorite winter activities is watching movies. But why spend a small fortune taking the families to the movies when you can stay at home for an even better theater experience? Host an unforgettable family movie night that's more than a couple of hours sitting on the couch together. Let the kids create movie tickets, make snacks and open their own concession stand. After the movie's over, let their inner critics write movie reviews.
04 of 12 Start Scrapbooking Photo © Hero Images / Getty Images We all love our digital cameras. But then our pictures usually sit on a hard drive and aren't viewed as much as the pictures we once took with our film cameras. Print your favorite pics and start scrapbooking with your kids. Theme your scrapbook pages for the winter and holidays with layout ideas and tips from other scrapbookers .
Continue to 5 of 12 below. 05 of 12 Go Skating Photo © Simone Ramella / Flickr Today's kids are plugged into their online social networks and their video games. Take them back to your own childhood when a Saturday night meant a trip to the skating rink. Roller skate or inline skate with your family or stay in that wintry mood with ice skating.
06 of 12 Create a Website With Your Kids Photo © Nancy Ney / Getty Images It's cold outside, so stay warm with the kids in front of the computer. Create a website together , even if you have no web design skills. You both can learn as you build a website that covers the life of their dog, a tribute to a favorite child star or a sampling of her short stories, to name a few of the possibilities. Learning how to maintain her own website is just one of many learning activities that are fun .
07 of 12 Redecorate the Kids' Rooms Photo © Hero Images / Getty Images Kids spend a lot of time within their four bedroom walls during the winter. Since you're stuck inside, re-energize their rooms by making redecorating one of your winter activities. Work closely with them to choose colors, themes and accessories to give their bedrooms a new look. As much as you may not want that fluorescent green color on the wall, try to relax some of your rules to give them ownership of the project.
08 of 12 Cook Together Photo © Yagi Studio / Getty Images We often unpack the cookie cutters around the holidays, but get the kids more involved in the kitchen. The youngest chefs-in-training can gather ingredients, help stir and clean up. Prepare crockpot soups and other winter recipes together to help your kids learn more about their food, nutrition values and healthy eating.
Continue to 9 of 12 below. 09 of 12 Donate to a Charity Photo © Images by Tang Ming Tung / Getty Images Get into the holiday spirit while teaching your kids how to be thankful. With so many charitable organizations relying on donations around the holidays, your kids can buy toys for less fortunate children or even pack up a shoe box of items with a personal note to send to children overseas. Pick any charity you feel is worthy or specifically look for holiday-related charity projects .
10 of 12 Volunteer Your Family's Time Photo © Brand X Pictures / Getty Images Let the kids volunteer during the winter. There are plenty of kid-friendly charity events where your family's help would be greatly appreciated. Serve food to the homeless for Thanksgiving and Christmas. Visit the elderly at a nursing home or hospital. Help your local animal shelter during an adopt-a-thon. Look over volunteer websites that match you and your family to the right opportunity based on your interests. Exposing your children to volunteering can open the door for a lifetime of ... MORE service to others.
11 of 12 Make Your Own Wrapping Paper Photo © Fotokia / Getty Images As children get ready to swap gifts with their friends, skip the high-priced wrapping paper at the store. Make your own wrapping paper with rubber stamps, and let the kids personalize it with their crayons, markers or stickers. Use the same ideas to create more handmade packages , such as gift boxes and gift bags.
12 of 12 Build Model Cars or a Dollhouse Photo © Sierra Tierra / Flickr Enjoy one-on-one time with your kids when you take on classic hobbies as a winter activity. Building die cast cars and dollhouses keeps you busy on those cold winter days and requires you and your children to work together as a team to complete the project.
If you're not sure you can handle these types of projects on your own at first, take the kids to a Lowe's Build and Grow workshop or a Home Depot Kids workshop. These workshops encourage kids to build everything from bug houses to ... MORE schoolhouses, and you can assist them as they create something out of wood.

thread.title: Free Low Cost DIY Earring Tutorials and Projects
thread.title_full: Free Low Cost DIY Earring Tutorials and Projects

posts.author: Kate Pullen
posts.title: Free Low Cost DIY Earring Tutorials and Projects
posts.text:
01 of 22 Free DIY Earring Tutorials and Projects Using Low Cost Supplies Handmade earring tutorials using low cost supplies. Kate Pullen While diamonds may well be a girl's best friend, there's a lot to be said for low-cost alternatives. And, if you're a little crafty, you'll find that you can make some stunning handmade earrings using low and no cost supplies and a few basic craft skills.
There are many benefits to making your own handmade earrings. Here are just a few:
Create earrings in a certain color to match an outfit or occasion Handmade earrings are a great way to practice or learn a new technique before committing to a ... MORE larger project Earrings make great gifts, make a few pairs and keep some to give friends as gifts. Supplies Required In this roundup of earrings made using low and no cost items, you'll be surprised at what you can make using just a few basic supplies. In each project besides the supplies you require to make the decorative earring component, you'll also need a pair of ear wires. You will find these in your local craft store as well as extensively online.
Continue to 2 of 22 below. 02 of 22 Make Paper Star Earrings Make paper star earrings. Kate Pullen These pretty earrings are made from folded paper stars. All you require is a strip of paper and some earring findings.
Go To Project Page
Continue to 3 of 22 below. 03 of 22 How to Make Paper Rose Earrings Learn how to make paper rose earrings. Honey's Quillng Who would believe that these pretty rose earrings started life as thin strips of paper? Learn how to make your own with this detailed tutorial.
Go To Project Page
Continue to 4 of 22 below. 04 of 22 DIY Copper Patina Earrings Copper patina earrings. Rena Klingenberg Stunning copper earrings needn't be difficult to make, find out how to make your own and apply a patina to give depth to the copper finish using the tutorial below.
Go To Project Page
Continue to 5 of 22 below. 05 of 22 Paper Bead Earrings Learn How to Make Paper Bead Earrings. Kalanirmitee Creations When it comes to making earrings, it doesn't come a lot cheaper than using paper beads - however, the end results belie the humble beginnings.
Go To Project Page
Continue to 6 of 22 below. 06 of 22 Credit Card Earrings Make Credit Card Earrings. Rain Blanken Instead of throwing out that old credit card, grab a pair of scissors and make yourself a cute pair of credit card earrings!
Go To Project Page
Continue to 7 of 22 below. 07 of 22 DIY Lace Earrings DIY Lace Earrings. Green Wedding Shoes If you have some lace trimming to hand, or a lace insert in a garment or home accessory that you can upcycle, then these super-attractive earrings are both low cost and simple to make. A winning combination!
Go To Project Page
Continue to 8 of 22 below. 08 of 22 Knotted Leather Earrings Knotted leather earrings. Hoi Pang via Pandahall This photo tutorial shows us how to create stunning knitted earrings from leather cord.
Go To Project Page
Continue to 9 of 22 below. 09 of 22 Stamped Paper Earrings Make a stunning pair of earrings using your rubber stamps and marker pens. Kate Pullen Frame settings are a useful craft supply to have to hand as they provide a quick and easy way to make jewelry using low cost supplies. In this project I use pieces of paper I have stamped and colored to create unique earrings.
Go To Project Page
Continue to 10 of 22 below. 10 of 22 Black and White Stamped Earrings Easy DIY earrings using rubber stamped images. Kate Pullen This is a black and white variation of the earring on the previous page.
Go To Project Page
Continue to 11 of 22 below. 11 of 22 Hot Glue Earrings Make cute earrings from hot glue drops. Four Front Doors If you love hot glue projects then you are going to go wild for this hot glue earring tutorial. These amazing earrings are made from drops of hot glue. This project costs just pennies to make, however the finished earrings look a million dollars!
Go To Project Page
Continue to 12 of 22 below. 12 of 22 Paper Bead Earrings Make paper bead earrings. Rita Shehan Paper beads are fun to make and are a great low cost way to make jewelry. Check out our roundup of over 20 fantastic paper bead projects , as well as taking a look at the tutorial below to learn how to make paper bead earrings.
Go To Project Page
Continue to 13 of 22 below. 13 of 22 Lace Covered Buttong Tutorial Lace covered button earrings. Evie S Create elegant stud earrings by covering buttons with a tiny piece of lace.
Go To Project Page
Continue to 14 of 22 below. 14 of 22 Scrap Fabric Earring Tutorial Make fabric earrings. Essie Sews Make these earrings from scraps of fabric. This is a nifty way to create earrings that complement an outfit. This project is so simple to do you could quickly create earrings to give as gifts.
Go To Project Page
Continue to 15 of 22 below. 15 of 22 Wrapped Paperclip Earrings Wrapped paperclip earrings. With One Hand Waving Free This is another who-would-believe-what-these-are-made-from projects. At the heart of these earrings is a simple 'unfolded' paper clip. Amazing results are achieved by wrapping yarn or thread around the unfolded paper clip to make attractive drops for earrings.
Go To Project Page
Continue to 16 of 22 below. 16 of 22 Lace Trim Earrings Make lace trim earrings. Tenth Muse Studios Learn how to turn lace trim into beautiful dangling lace earrings. This tutorial also shows how to stiffen the lace to create more robust earrings.
Go To Project Page
Continue to 17 of 22 below. 17 of 22 DIY Leather Triangle Dangle Earrings Leather triangle earrings. Hello Natural Make these earrings using a few scraps of leather. They are going to be lightweight and comfortable to wear, as well as being quick to make.
Go To Project Page
Continue to 18 of 22 below. 18 of 22 Beaded Hoop Earrings Beaded hoop earrings. Lisa Yang Here's a great way to give an existing pair of hoop earrings a makeover.
Go To Project Page
Continue to 19 of 22 below. 19 of 22 Polymer Clay Stamped Earrings Rubber Stamped Polymer Clay Earrings. Kate Pullen This is another one of my tutorials and in this one I show how to make a pair of earrings using polymer clay as a base to stamp into. This technique is almost infinitely variable, meaning you can create unique earrings and other items of jewelry.
Go To Project Page
Continue to 20 of 22 below. 20 of 22 Gemstone Dangle Earrings Make gemstone dangle earrings. Lisa Yang This is a great project to get started making bead jewelry. Learn how to create these pretty earrings using this detailed photo tutorial.
Go To Project Page
Continue to 21 of 22 below. 21 of 22 Paper Clip Earrings Paper bead earrings. Rain Blanken Here's another pair of earrings which feature a paper clip as the base structure. In these earrings beads are threaded onto the unfolded paper clip.
Continue to 22 of 22 below. 22 of 22 Polymer Clay Earrings Make polymer clay earrings. Kate Pullen These earrings use just a tiny amount of polymer clay which is rolled into a thin sheet and cut to fit the inside of a frame setting. Simple to do with great looking end results.

thread.title: Basic Small Box Template for Customizing
thread.title_full: Basic Small Box Template for Customizing

posts.author: Kate Pullen
posts.title: Basic Small Box Template for Customizing
posts.text:
01 of 03 Basic Box Template for Customizing Basic Paper Box. Kate Pullen This is a basic box template that is ideal for customizing. This box is as basic as they come - however this is what makes it so good for decorating and customizing. The template has been used to make the simple gift box above - however take a look at the next page to see what a few embellishments can do!
The box can be customized in a number of ways. Here are some ideas:
Decorate the box with rubber stamps. It is best to stamp the box before it is folded. Attach a photograph to the front of the ... MORE box to give it a really personal feel. Use these boxes to contain party or wedding favors. Decorate the box so it matches other decorations or decorative themes. Add a flap to one end of the box. Make 25 of these boxes and number each one from 1 to 25. Hang these from a ribbon and use as an advent calendar or as a count-down calendar to any special occasion. Use old calendars or other unwanted materials to make these boxes. These can then be decorated further using rubber stamps and inks in an 'altered art' style. These boxes are perfect for using as the base for simple paper toys. Add features and arms, legs and other embellishments to make your own custom paper toy! See Page Three for the template. Continue to 2 of 3 below. 02 of 03 Basic Paper Box - Angel Basic Paper Box - Angel. Kate Pullen The basic paper box can be dressed up in many ways to make an unusual gift box or ornament. The simple box template has been dressed up to make this angel. Some rubber stamped paper has been used to make wings and arms, a few pieces of normal kitchen baking foil has been used to make hair and a disc of paper has been painted gold to make a halo to create an unusual gift box which would also double as an unusual tree ornament.
See the next page for the basic box template.
Continue to 3 of 3 below. 03 of 03 Basic Box Template Basic Box Template. Kate Pullen To print the template, simply clickHERE to open the full size version of the template. Then right click on that image and select 'Save Image' to save onto your computer. Print as required.
Tips for Using Templates To save paper, print onto scrap paper and then draw around the template onto best paper or cardstock. This will allow you to place the templates in a way that wastes the least amount of paper. Keep templates filed with a note of the website address. This will help you find the page again ... MORE if you need to (or save the url in your bookmarks). Most templates can be sized up or down on a printer or photocopier For more gift box templates see - Gift Boxes and Packaging where you'll find a selection of gift boxes and gift bag templates for all occasions, including wedding, birthdays and general festivities!

thread.title: Easy Paper Gift Bag Tutorial
thread.title_full: Easy Paper Gift Bag Tutorial

posts.author: Kate Pullen
posts.title: Easy Paper Gift Bag Tutorial
posts.text:
01 of 06 Easy Paper Gift Bag to Make Easy Paper Box or Bag to Make. Kate Pullen Here's a cute idea for a really quick gift bag to make. You can create this bag out of a single sheet of paper - and then really go to town with decorations!
The key proportions of this easy to make bag remain the same whether you are making a tiny bag for a couple of special candies or a bag for a larger present. This makes this a highly adaptable and versatile bag as it can be used for a whole variety of occasions. The bag can be rubber stamped, adorned with stamped embellishments, given ... MORE handles, tied with ribbons, made with lightweight paper or sturdy card.... the opportunities are almost endless!
The template on the following page demonstrates how this bag is formed.
Continue to 2 of 6 below. 02 of 06 Gift Bag Template Get the PDF template below. Kate Pullen The reason why this gift bag is so adaptable is because the proportions between the sides always remains the same. The front and back of the bag are always twice the width of the sides, whether it is a tiny or large bag. These proportions give a tidy and firm base to the base of the bag. The bag can be made as tall or as short as you like!
Variations
Place a crease down the center of either side and fold the top of the bag over to create a bag that is ideal for confetti or small items Punch two ... MORE holes in the top of the bag at the front and back, threading ribbon or cord through to form handles. Prepare a few undecorated bags and store flat. These can quickly be decorated with rubber stamps that are appropriate to the occasion for any last minute gifts! To Make the Bag Take a piece of paper the required size.
Tip: Before making this bag with good paper, print the template out (click on the image to open the full size version and then right-click on it and choose 'Save image as' to save it to your computer) on scratch paper and practice making the bags first. This is also a good way to try out different stamping and decoration techniques and to practice the placement of stamped images. Continue to 3 of 6 below. 03 of 06 Fold and Cut Fold and cut. Kate Pullen If the bag is to be stamped and decorated then it is a good idea to do this before folding and cutting the template. Draw, score and fold the lines of the template. Cut up to the bottom fold along the 4 marked cut lines. Continue to 4 of 6 below. 04 of 06 Glue the Sides Glue the sides. Kate Pullen Run glue or adhesive along the outside edge of the overlap piece and press this to the inside of the other edge. Use paper clips or pegs to hold the pieces together to dry. Continue to 5 of 6 below. 05 of 06 Fold and Glue the Base Fold and glue the base. Kate Pullen When dry, make the base of the bag by folding the two shorter side pieces in together. Take a look at the bag and determine which side, if any, is to be the front of the bag. Fold the back base first and the front base last, adding a dab of glue as required, this gives a neat finish to the bag. See the next page for a picture of the finished bag and some ideas for how to embellish it further! Continue to 6 of 6 below. 06 of 06 Finished Gift Bag Finished Gift Bag. Kate Pullen The finished gift bag can be decorated in a variety of ways. This gift bag has been embellished with a large three dimensional decoupage decoration. Here are some ideas for other ways of finishing the bag:
Paper Flowers - add a few small paper flowers to give the bag a striking finish Flocking - add some flocking for a textured effect Embellishments - add some of your favorite embellishments to brighten up the bag If you have created this bag and have some pictures to show, why not pop into a ... MORE Rubber Stamping Forum and share your work with others!

There are variations of two style of printable favor box. One style is created from a single piece of paper, the other is a small box with a decorative wrapper. These tiny boxes are fun to make. This is a versatile box and a sentiment can be stamped or written onto the front or back and the box decorated with rubber stamps. Change the sentiment, colors and paper to create boxes for any occasion. Resize the template if you require a larger version.
Go to Project Page
Continue to 4 of 6 below. 04 of 06 Small Heart Favor Box Small Heart Box. Kate Pullen This small heart printable favor box is ideal for weddings, engagements and Valentine's Day. It is also a cute little box to present a small candy or two to someone simply to say that you are thinking of them. This box is made in two pieces with an inner box and outer cover which can be decorated with rubber stamps, marker pens and with other embellishments.
Go to Project Page
Continue to 5 of 6 below. 05 of 06 House Favor Box Small House Favor Box. Kate Pullen Print this small house favor box to make a fun house warming present. The house is available in two versions, one with windows and a door and the other without. This little box is made from a single piece. Use your printer or photocopier to resize the template if you require a larger version.
Go to Project Page
Continue to 6 of 6 below. 06 of 06 Round Top Favor Box Round Top Favor Box. Kate Pullen The rounded shape of this small printable favor box makes it ideal for many occasions. This little box is formed from two pieces - an inner box with an outer cover.
Go to Project Page
If you want to add a digital stamp or two to your projects then check out these collections:
All Occasion Digital Stamps Christmas and Holidays Digital Stamps Halloween Digital Stamps Printable Frames and Borders Printable Sentiments These favor boxes are perfect for giving small gift at weddings, birthdays and other ... MORE celebrations. You can customize these boxes so quickly and easily using rubber stamps and different colored paper to coordinate with your theme. This is a great way to make low cost favors but with the personal touch. Why not make a few extra and keep to one side to use as gift boxes if you need a small gift box to give a gift for a special occasion.

More Handmade Basket Tutorials Don't forget to check out more tutorials here - 9 Handmade Easter Basket Tutorials
Use one of the free printable templates on the following pages (tray with stitching, tray with glued edges or small tray templates) to make a pretty folded paper tray in three different styles. This folded paper tray is easy to make and can be used in a variety of ways. Use the tray to ... MORE hold or display small items. The template is available in two sizes and with two options for construction. Either adhere the sides together with glue or double sided tape or tie the edges together with ribbon. Stitching is an interesting variation as this holds the edges of the tray together while adding additional detail. Use a contrasting colored ribbon to emphasize the stitching. Tie a bow through the holes shown on the template or make a row of stitches as we've demonstrated in the picture above.
How to Make a Folded Paper Tray Print one of the templates on the following pages - template with stitching, template with glued edges or small tray templates onto scrap paper and transfer this to a piece of cardstock Cut around the template and score along the fold lines, this will give a good crisp edge Stamp and decorate the paper as required Depending on your chosen method for constructing the tray, either pierce holes for the stitching using the guidelines on the template or in another position if preferred and stitch the edges of the box together, or, if you are using the template with flaps, glue the flaps together to form the tray More Gift Packaging Templates and Projects For a wide selection of other gift packaging templates and projects, including both gift bags and gift boxes that are perfect for customizing to any occasion see - Gift Packaging Projects .

thread.title: Top 10 Middle Eastern Sandwich Recipes
thread.title_full: Top 10 Middle Eastern Sandwich Recipes

posts.author: MacKenzie Smith
posts.title: Top 10 Middle Eastern Sandwich Recipes
posts.text:
01 of 10 NYC Style Falafel Sandwich Recipe NYC Style Falafel Sandwich. Grilled Cheese Social This tasty NYC style falafel sandwich recipe is inspired by the 24-hour middle eastern restaurants that line the streets of Brooklyn and Manhattan. Fresh fried falafel balls, pickled vegetables, herbs, greek yogurt, and a quick and easy lemon garlic tahini dressing are stuffed into a warm pita and drizzled with hot sauce if desired.
Continue to 2 of 10 below. 02 of 10 Mediterranean Lamb Burger Mediterranean Lamb Burger. Grilled Cheese Social These crispy lamb burgers covered with rich tzatziki, refreshing mint, sweet roasted tomatoes, and spicy red onions on a toasted ciabatta bun will make your next BBQ so much better. Want more options? If you're a cheese lover, try adding salty feta cheese or crumbled ricotta salata. Don't want to eat all that bread? Try stuffing miniature whole wheat pitas for a healthy twist.
Continue to 3 of 10 below. 03 of 10 Middle Eastern Vegetarian Pita Sandwich Middle Eastern Vegetable Pita Sandwich. Grilled Cheese Social This Middle Eastern Vegetarian Pita Sandwich is stuffed with homemade tzatziki, homemade tabbouleh, feta cheese, fresh vegetables and a lot of fresh herbs. Craving something with a little bit of heat? Try this spicy Middle Eastern hot sauce made with harissa, garlic and tomato paste.
Continue to 4 of 10 below. 04 of 10 Greek Souvlaki Chicken Gyro Wrap Easy Chicken Gyro Wrap. Grilled Cheese Social This Greek chicken souvlaki gyro sandwich recipe uses fresh marinated chicken which is cooked over a hot grill and then stuffed into a warm pita and topped with homemade tzatziki, tomato, onion, lettuce, and fresh dill.
Continue to 5 of 10 below. 05 of 10 Indian Spiced Lamb Korma Meatball Sandwich lamb korma meatball sandwich. Grilled Cheese Social This delicious Indian Spiced Lamb sandwich is made with graham masala spiced meatballs which are then simmered in a rich, creamy, and sweet korma sauce, topped with tart yogurt and fragrant mint chutney.
Continue to 6 of 10 below. 06 of 10 Classic Spiced Lamb Gyro Lamb gyro. Grilled Cheese Social Crispy slices of spiced lamb, juicy ripe tomatoes, crunchy red onions, creamy tzatziki sauce, crisp cucumbers, leafy spinach and tangy feta cheese are nestled in a buttery and airy piece of pita bread in this delicious spiced lamb gyro .
Continue to 7 of 10 below. 07 of 10 Paneer Grilled Cheese with Pickled Vegetable + Curry Paneer Grilled Cheese with Pickled Vegetable + Curry. Grilled Cheese Social Quick pickled slaw, made with carrots, cucumber, onion, mint and cilantro, paneer cheese, and yellow curry sauce get grilled between two crispy pieces of naan bread to make one Indian style grilled cheese that is crisp and fresh.
Continue to 8 of 10 below. 08 of 10 Curry Chicken Salad Sandwich Recipe Curry Chicken Salad Recipe. Grilled Cheese Social This robust and flavorful curry chicken salad sandwich is made with a mixture of greek yogurt and mayonnaise, so it has a much lighter taste with more health benefits than your typical calorie packed chicken salad. Greek yogurt not only provides a nice tangy bite, but it's also full of probiotics and live cultures that help aid digestion and speed up metabolism.
I recommend using this curry chicken salad as a sandwich recipe between two toasted slices of a pumpkin bagel (for a hint of ... MORE sweetness), a drizzle of sriracha (for heat), a few cucumbers (for crunch, and lastly, a handful of kale leaves (for extra health benefits) but feel free to use it on whatever vessel you care for!
Continue to 9 of 10 below. 09 of 10 Curried Meatball Sliders Curried Meatball Sliders. Grilled Cheese Social Curried meatballs, cherry peppers, and Thai basil come together between two buttery toasted slices of French bread on these flavorful little curried meatball sliders . For a variation of this recipe, try swapping out the red curry for yellow curry and add crushed peanuts, pickled bamboo shoots, and a citrusy carrot slaw.
You can also use a green curry base and a few more toppings like fresh bean sprouts, a few sprigs of mint and cilantro, and a squeeze of fresh lime juice.
Continue to 10 of 10 below. 10 of 10 The Best Vegetarian Hummus and Pickled Vegetable Sandwich Hummus and Pickled Vegetable Sandwich. Grilled Cheese Social This simple and delicious hummus and pickled vegetable sandwich is anything but boring!
Say goodbye to lifeless limp vegetables and start piling on loads of these tangy pickled veggies, some savory protein-packed hummus, and crisp, fresh produce. These veggies are just my recommendation and personal preference but feel free to try switching up the veggies to create a sandwich that's full of flavor and chocked full of vitamins and nutrients.

thread.title: Guide to French Regional Recipes and Foods
thread.title_full: Guide to French Regional Recipes and Foods

posts.author: Rebecca Franklin
posts.title: Guide to French Regional Recipes and Foods
posts.text:
01 of 09 Alsace and Lorraine Recipes Alsace-Lorraine. Frank Krahmer/Getty Images From the high mountains of Alsace and Lorraine to the sun-drenched countryside of Provence, France is widely varied in culinary traditions. Learn more about the foods, ingredients, and recipes of each region.
Germany and France alternated ruling the area of Alsace-Lorraine, in northeastern France, for several centuries. Over time, Germany’s influence on traditional French dishes became apparent. Alsatians and Lorrainers have become masters of pickling, smoking meats, and packing sausages. They ... MORE place a high importance on the impeccable quality of their rustic food products.
Baeckeoffe Recipe Baked Apricots Recipe Braised Red Cabbage Recipe Cucumber Salad Recipe Garlic Turkey Sausage Recipe Quiche Lorraine Recipe Continue to 2 of 9 below. 02 of 09 Cajun and Creole Recipes St. Louis Cathedral, New Orleans, Louisiana. Medioimages/Photodisc/Getty Images Cajun and Creole recipes come from a wide swath of geography that encompasses Canada from the Gulf of Saint Lawrence in Northeastern Canada down to areas of Lousiana in the United States. A rich blended heritage of French, Spanish, African, and Caribbean cultures have contributed to flavorful Cajun and Creole food.
Andouille Balsamic Vinaigrette Recipe Cinnamon Orange Popovers Recipe Cognac Shrimp with Beurre Blanc Sauce Recipe Crab Quiche Recipe Orange Rice Recipe Oyster Soup ... MORE Recipe Continue to 3 of 9 below. 03 of 09 Foods of Belgium Maison du Roi, Brussels, Belgium. Robert Harding/Getty Images Belgium borders northeast France and takes its cuisine from a tumultuous history of invasions and reign by the Romans, Vikings, Germans, Austrians, French, German, Spanish, and Dutch. Belgian recipes are famous for having the quality and finesse of French cuisine while being served in the big portions by which German cuisine is known.
Belgian Orange Blossom Recipe Belgian Waffles Recipe Cream of Belgian Endive Soup Recipe Flemish Beef Stew Recipe Frites Recipe Mixed Belgian ... MORE Endive Salad Recipe Steamed Mussels in Vermouth Recipe Continue to 4 of 9 below. 04 of 09 Foods of Brittany Fort La Latte, Brittany, France. Robert Harding/Getty Images Situated at the northwestern tip of France, Brittany juts out into the sea, making seafood its prime cuisine. Recipes from Brittany are filled with fresh fish, apples, and famous buckwheat crepes.
Apple and Calvados Sorbet Recipe Buckwheat Crepes Recipe Chicken and Mushroom Crepes Recipe Chicken in Hard Cider Sauce Recipe Oyster Soup Recipe Smoked Salmon and Dill Crepes Recipe Tomato and Spinach Crepes Recipe Continue to 5 of 9 below. 05 of 09 Foods of Burgundy Chateau De La Rochepot Castle, Cote D'Or, Burgundy, France. Medioimages/Photodisc/Getty Images Recipes from Burgundy borrow heavily from its Germanic heritage. They often feature – and always complement - the world-renowned wines made in the region.
French Hazelnut Gingerbread Recipe Glace au Pain d’Epices Recipe Beef Burgundy Recipe Gougeres Recipe Winter Squash Puree Recipe Continue to 6 of 9 below. 06 of 09 Foods of French Canada Chateau Frontenac, Quebec City, Quebec, Canada. Stuart Gregory/Getty Images Consisting mainly of Quebec and eastern Canada, French Canadian recipes combine French culinary techniques with local North American ingredients. The resulting food is deliciously homestyle with incredible French panache.
Apple Glazed Carrots Recipe Blueberry Port-Style Wine Recipe Blueberry Wine Coulis Recipe Chocolate Torte with Blueberry Wine Coulis Recipe Cranberry Quatre Quarts Cake Recipe Maple Walnut Vinaigrette Recipe Pomegranate Cranberry Sorbet Recipe Pumpkin ... MORE Mousse Recipe Roasted Maple Orange Glazed Turkey Recipe Continue to 7 of 9 below. 07 of 09 Foods of Gascony and Basque Country Basque Country. Emma Lee/Life File/Getty Images Food from Basque country and Gascony is traditionally hearty fare for the weathered workers of the rural, mountainous area. The wholesome, often spicy recipes come from a blended heritage of Viking invasions, and French and Spanish culture.
Armagnac Crème Anglaise Recipe Basque Piperade Sauce Recipe Quick Onion Confit Recipe Continue to 8 of 9 below. 08 of 09 Foods of Normandy Sheep grazing near Mont Saint Michel, Normandy, France. Martial Colomb/Getty Images Normandy is beautiful farm country by the sea. The resulting cuisine is rich with dairy products, orchard fruit, and fresh-from-the-water seafood.
Andouille Balsamic Vinaigrette Recipe Apple and Calvados Sorbet Recipe Cinnamon Espresso Sables Recipe Chicken in Hard Cider Sauce Recipe Frites Recipe Simple Brioche Loaf Recipe Continue to 9 of 9 below. 09 of 09 Foods of Provence Provence, France. Tom Brakefield/Getty Images Recipes from Provence are full of fresh fruits and vegetables thanks to the temperate, sunny climate and carefully tended farmland.
Avocado and Romaine Salad Recipe Brandade de Morue Marseilles Recipe Calissons with Meringue Recipe Cote d’Azur Lemon Honey Dressing Recipe Herbes de Provence Vinaigrette Recipe Lemon Aioli Recipe Provencal Tomato Rice Soup Recipe Snapper en Papillote Recipe Zesty Tapenade Recipe
